page.title: 03Michaelston Church
page.content: Michaelston-le-Pit is only four miles from the capital of Wales, but it is a village with no through road, no railway and no post office or school. Its only public building, the Church of St Michael and All Angels,is set in the hollow which gives the village its name, and its secluded position has saved it from depredation and even from too drastic a restoration. It is a Norman foundation, its first known records being dated 12O3. Its present building is cruciform in shape and the roof of the south porch is supported on the original wooden trusses and the mid-fourteenth century doorway still bears traces of the original moldings. The shapes of the five windows in the nave illustrate successive stages of development from Early English to Perpendicular.
